text: Hi all, quick question, on the new design manager there is no more html/hubl module. what is the best solution to write hubl code?

Hi <@U7VHQMEV7> - in the new beta design manager you'll need to: 
> Create a new file by right clicking in a directory, then select _Create New File_
> Under _Components_ select _Module_
> Select where you'd like to use the module and content scope
> Give the module a filename

You can then write self-contained HTML/HubL, CSS and JavaScript
<https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/new-design-manager>
Hi <@U9MAWTESW> so is going to be a local module, right?
Yeah, that's correct :thumbsup:
thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey guys!
Anybody discovered an issue when editing Smart rules in the new HubSpot Beta?
Currently, its not saving any modifications I make to rules, and just reverts back to default :confused:
Haven’t tried to do what you’re saying but it might be related - one of my co-workers found that using the smart rules in an email template was kinda janky compared to the old way they were handled.
I'm currently in touch with HS Support, and they seem to be struggling with it too, so looks like a bug in the software :scream:
:disappointed: hope they get that fixed quickly, we have some clients that would probably be pretty upset if we upgraded their design manager and that wasn’t working.

Random question: one of our campaign managers was just told by HS that the sandbox URLs should be sandbox.hs-sites/…….. instead, we have always seen "<http://sandbox.hs-sites.com/|sandbox.hs-sites.com/>"
Can anyone confirm which one they see in their own HS content staging?
this is what i see
<http://www.domain.sandbox.hs-sites.com|www.domain.sandbox.hs-sites.com>
<@U26D0TF8E> this is what I have `<http://www-domain-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/>`
thank you y'all...glad to hear we are not setup differently

Finally!?! :raised_hands::skin-tone-3::raised_hands::skin-tone-3::applause:
<http://partner-betas.HubSpot.com/in-beta-a/b-testing-for-web-pages>
Ohhhhh!!! So God!
*Good!

sandbox.hs-sites/ would require them to own the .hs-sites TLD basically, and not likely to happen.

.sandbox might be a TLD though, if it’s not it should be, it’d be cool.
I let our campaign manager know something similar, I think there is some confusion on the part of the person who shared that info
There's a ".sb" for the Solomon Islands apparently. There's also ".dev", those are the closest I can think of.
thanks for looking into those!
To be clear, not saying HubSpot *has* those TLDs, just that they would be good fits if they wanted to get cute :slightly_smiling_face:
